meanings.definition: A unit of digital information equal to one quintillion (10^18) bytes.
meanings.sent1: An exabyte is a massive amount of data storage.
meanings.sent2: The computer's hard drive had an exabyte of storage space.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fit an exabyte of information on a floppy disk - it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an exabyte, storing every detail of every day.
meanings.sent5: The exabyte of data was enough to fill a thousand libraries.

meanings.definition: A very large amount of data storage capacity, typically used to measure computer memory or disk space.
meanings.sent1: The company's server farm had an exabyte of storage capacity.
meanings.sent2: Storing an exabyte of photos requires a lot of memory.
meanings.sent3: He claimed to have an exabyte of jokes stored in his brain.
meanings.sent4: The cloud storage was like an exabyte ocean, vast and endless.
meanings.sent5: Trying to comprehend an exabyte of data is like counting grains of sand on a beach.
